title: Logan Yuzna
text:
Logan Yuzna is an American artist, filmmaker, comedian, rapper, and skateboarder in <a href="Hollywood">Hollywood</a>, California.
Career.
Logan Yuzna has written and directed several independent films including the <a href="Academy%20Awards">Academy Award</a> winner <a href="Spike%20Jonze">Spike Jonze</a>'s 2018 <a href="Girl%20Distribution%20Company">Chocolate</a> Film Festival official selection film "It's a Skater".
Yuzna starts his film career at the Kingraisin channel, the first music video platform in <a href="skateboarding">skateboarding</a>, where Yuzna creates comedy Hip-Hop <a href="live%20action">live action</a> and <a href="animated">animated</a> narratives about Skateboarding. Some of these films include "Skaters Paradise" and "All I Need is Red Curbs". Critics have said about Yuzna's work that he "created a genre" especially with his <a href="Splatter%20film">gore</a> <a href="parody">parody</a>, "Skaters in Perish". Yuzna released the animation "Where's Stoner at" in 2014; that same year, he accepted an offer from <a href="Marvel%20Animation%20Studios">Marvel Animation Studios</a> to join the production team of Marvel's "<a href="Avengers%20Assemble%20%28TV%20series%29">Avengers Assemble</a>", working immediately after on Marvel's "Avengers: Ultron Revolution", and then recruited for a Marvel secret project that was revealed to be Marvel's <a href="Spider-Man">Spider-Man</a> TV series at <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a> <a href="Comic-Con">Comic-Con</a> 2016.
Yuzna performs in character as the Raisinman in the Kingraisin web series, where he <a href="Rapping">raps</a> and <a href="Parody">parodies</a> skateboarding and <a href="Hip%20hop">Hip-Hop</a> culture. Some of the episodes have gone <a href="viral%20video">viral</a> on the internet, like "Pushin' Mongo". Yuzna started producing <a href="instrumentals">instrumentals</a> while living in <a href="Barcelona">Barcelona</a> as a teen <a href="Record%20producer">producer</a> and <a href="rapper">rapper</a>, featuring his own music in the Raisinman Productions films. Since 2017 Yuzna is part of the Los Angeles <a href="Improvisational%20theatre">improvisational</a> and sketch comedy troupe <a href="The%20Groundlings">The Groundlings</a>.
A known skateboarder, Yuzna stars in the 2009 <a href="Apple%20Inc.">Apple</a> Mac photo campaign, for which he appears skateboarding in <a href="Venice%20Beach">Venice Beach</a>, California. Outside of Skateboarding, Yuzna has worked <a href="Advertising">commercially</a> in the arts and fashion industries as a film director in <a href="New%20York%20Fashion%20Week">New York Fashion Week</a>, <a href="La%20Biennale%20di%20Venezia">La Biennale di Venezia</a>, and other international events for artists and brands.
<a href="Transworld%20Skateboarding">Transworld Skateboarding</a> says that "Kingraisin drops Lyrical bangers" in his <a href="rap">rap</a>s.
Recognition.
The Kingraisin channel reached worldwide recognition in 2011 when "<a href="GQ">GQ</a>" said Yuzna's rap was "killer" and "needed", and <a href="Transworld%20Skateboarding">Transworld Skateboarding</a> featured Yuzna as their top <a href="YouTuber">YouTuber</a>. Kingraisin's skateboarding narratives are regularly featured in <a href="Tony%20Hawk">Tony Hawk</a>'s Ride Channel, <a href="Thrasher%20%28magazine%29">Thrasher</a> magazine, <a href="Transworld%20Skateboarding">Transworld</a>, and <a href="Skateboarder%20%28magazine%29">SkateBoarder</a> magazine. A part of the arts community in Los Angeles, Yuzna is one of the artists interviewed by <a href="NPR">NPR National Public Radio</a> about <a href="Banksy">Banksy</a> when the street artist reportedly spray-painted prominent walls in Los Angeles during Oscars week. Yuzna is frequently seen at skateboarding events with other skaters, being photographed with <a href="Eric%20Koston">Eric Koston</a> at the <a href="Spike%20Jonze">Spike Jonze</a> <a href="Her%20%28film%29">Her</a> Oscar celebration in 2014. He was followed by <a href="MTV">MTV</a> News for the network's <a href="docu-series">docu-series</a> during the <a href="Coachella%20Valley%20Music%20and%20Arts%20Festival">Coachella Music Festival</a> in 2016. Prominent in social media, Yuzna was called a YouTube sensation and became the Los Angeles reporter for "<a href="Empire%20%28film%20magazine%29">Empire</a>", covering the <a href="Golden%20Globe%20Award">Golden Globe Award</a>s ceremony and red carpet. He has also appeared multiple times as a reporter for "Thrasher"s Skateline, portraying the Bob Raisinman character.
Personal life.
Logan Yuzna was born in <a href="Los%20Angeles">Los Angeles</a>, California, to Cathy and <a href="Brian%20Yuzna">Brian Yuzna</a>. He has three siblings, Conan Yuzna, Zoe Yuzna, and Noah Yuzna. Logan grew up on set at his father's Hollywood film productions, and participated as a child actor in the American films , <a href="Progeny%20%28film%29">Progeny</a>, , and <a href="The%20Dentist%202">The Dentist 2</a>. At age 11 Logan moved to <a href="Barcelona">Barcelona</a>, Spain, with his family. He started <a href="skateboarding">skateboarding</a> while living in Barcelona and is named Raisinman, a nickname that would become a character in the Kingraisin universe and, later on, label Yuzna's own production company Raisinman Productions. At age 18, bilingual in Spanish and English, Yuzna moved back to <a href="Los%20Angeles">Los Angeles</a> and studies in <a href="Santa%20Monica%20College">Santa Monica College</a> until the institution announced his transfer to <a href="University%20of%20California%2C%20Los%20Angeles">UCLA</a>, as published on the cover of their newspaper. In April 2016 Yuzna told <a href="MTV">MTV</a> that he was romantically involved with actress <a href="Diana%20Lado">Diana Lado</a>, while they were both for the network's <a href="docu-series">docu-series</a> surrounding the <a href="Coachella%20Valley%20Music%20and%20Arts%20Festival">Coachella music festival</a>. Yuzna has expressed homages to his father's work, artistically and in the media, producing the <a href="Brian%20Yuzna">Brian Yuzna</a> retrospective that showed at the <a href="Soho%20House">Soho House</a> theater in <a href="West%20Hollywood">West Hollywood</a>. Father and son often make appearances together, having been photographed at Hollywood events like the <a href="United%20Nations">United Nations</a> soiree hosted at producer <a href="Brett%20Ratner">Brett Ratner</a>'s <a href="Beverly%20Hills">Beverly Hills</a> home in August 2016.
